It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. This epiphytic plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on tree trunks or rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its small, inconspicuous spore-producing structures are arranged in clusters on the underside of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
